arm_group.description: Patients who will receive prednisolone medication (2 mg/kg/day ) for 16 weeks
Patients who will receive propranolol medication 2 mg/kg/day for 16 weeks

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine the safety and efficiency of Propranolol as an
      initial treatment for pediatric hemangioma.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Safety and Efficiency of Propranolol as an Initial Treatment for Pediatric Hemangioma

detailed_description.textblock:
-  Randomized (A group : propranolol, B group : prednisolone)

        -  A group : 3 days admission and medication for 16 weeks

        -  B group : medication for 16 weeks without admission

        -  Hemangioma volume comparison by using MRI

        -  other measurement and drug adverse reaction monitoring

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Hemangioma patient ( 0 ~ 9 months old)

          -  No treatment before

          -  10 ~ 20 % volume increase in 2 ~ 4 weeks

          -  Hemangioma that caused organ function

          -  Hemangioma that will cause aesthetic problem

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Cardiovascular disease (impossible to use propranolol)

          -  Drug adverse reaction or allergy history (propranolol, steroid)

          -  Bradycardia, Atrioventricular block, atrial block

          -  Cardiogenic Shock

          -  Right heart failure (pulmonary hypertension)

          -  Congestive heart failure

          -  Hypotension

          -  Peripheral nerve disease (moderate)

          -  Angina

          -  Hormone deficiency patient

          -  Pulmonary disease (asthma)

          -  diabetic ketoacidosis

          -  laser treatment history

contact.last_name: Tae Hyun Choi, MD, Ph D

clinical_study.official_title: The Safety and Efficiency of Propranolol as an Initial Treatment for Pediatric Hemangioma

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: We compared hemangioma volume measured by MRI or SONO, before and 16 weeks after medications.
primary_outcome.measure: Hemangioma volume measured by MRI or SONO

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Measure the horizontal and vertical size (2-dimension)
Heart rate fall to <70% of acceptable age related minimum post-dose with child awake
secondary_outcome.measure: Heart rate change from Baseline at 16 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Measure the horizontal and vertical size (2-dimension)
The time when hemangioma stop growing within 16 weeks
The time when hemangioma decreased to 75% of baseline size
Check the number of having drugs and skip time.
Systolic blood pressure fall of >25% of baseline postdose with child awake
secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in systolic blood pressure at 16 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: Check the Glucose level whether to fall (to <50mg/dl)
secondary_outcome.measure: Changes from baseline in Glucose level at 16 weeks
Whether the facial edema occurs within 16 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: When the subject do not grow in 16 weeks at all.
secondary_outcome.measure: Whether growth retardation occurs within 16 weeks
Whether the Gastroesophageal reflux occurs within 16 weeks

secondary_outcome.description: All symptoms associated adverse drug reaction will be checked
secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse drug reaction

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
